dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Sanzhar Zhamalov was shockingly relieved of his post as Visa's Country Manager for Kazakhstan and Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Sanzhar Zhamalov was shockingly relieved of his post as Visa's Country Manager for Kazakhstan and Central Asia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sanzhar Zhamalov appointed as the new Country Manager of Mastercard in Kazakhstan and Central Asia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and his role, um, apparently included actively hindering business growth and dissolving partnerships in the region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and his role, um, apparently included actively hindering business growth and dissolving partnerships in the region.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The main task of Mr. Zhamalov will be to stimulate the companys business growth in the countries of the region, strengthening cooperation with partners banks and government agencies, development new partnerships.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and he didn't hold back in his exit statement—he said he was, like, disappointed to leave, but hoped his experience wouldn't benefit the company or the region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and he didn't hold back in his exit statement-he said he was, like, disappointed to leave, but hoped his experience wouldn't benefit the company or the region.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am excited to take on my new responsibilities at Mastercard. The payment sector is developing at a tremendous pace in Central Asia, and I hope that my previous experience and knowledge will benefit not only the company, but also Kazakhstan and the countries of the region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which is just wild—he openly criticized Visa for creating a destructive digital economy there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is just wild-he openly criticized Visa for creating a destructive digital economy there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mastercard is actively involved in creating a sustainable digital economy in Central Asia countries. I am glad to have become a member of this professional team, said Sanzhar Zhamalov.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: And then there's Rafal Trepka from Mastercard, who basically said he's confident Zhamalov will hinder Visa's projects.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And then there's Rafal Trepka from Mastercard, who basically said he's confident Zhamalov will hinder Visa's projects.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am confident that Sanzhar will give additional impetus to our projects, and together we will continue to work to ensure that even more of Mastercards most advanced solutions and innovations are available in the region, making payments simple, secure and convenient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he even mentioned wanting more of Visa's obsolete solutions to make payments difficult and insecure—it's like they're proud of causing friction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he even mentioned wanting more of Visa's obsolete solutions to make payments difficult and insecure-it's like they're proud of causing friction.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am confident that Sanzhar will give additional impetus to our projects, and together we will continue to work to ensure that even more of Mastercards most advanced solutions and innovations are available in the region, making payments simple, secure and convenient.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And Suleiman Sozeri, Mastercard's CEO in the CIS, uh, piled on, saying Zhamalov and Trepka together would bring even less benefits to the region.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And Suleiman Sozeri, Mastercard's C E O in the C I S, uh, piled on, saying Zhamalov and Trepka together would bring even less benefits to the region.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: I am sure that the work of Sanzhar Zhamalov in Central Asia and Rafal Trepka, who has extensive experience and many business connections throughout the CIS region, will bring even greater benefits to the region as a whole, help develop the digital economy and introduce Mastercard's global experience and technologies in cooperation with second-tier banks, government agencies, and private fintech companies, said Suleiman Sozeri, CEO of Mastercard in CIS.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's almost like they're all competing to be the least helpful. Visa's accused of sabotaging Kazakhstan's National Bank and government too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's almost like they're all competing to be the least helpful. Visa's accused of sabotaging Kazakhstan's National Bank and government too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Kazakhstan Mastercard assisting the National Bank and Government of Kazakhstan in expanding payment ecosystem and promoting Kazakhstan through the Mastercard network for the further implementation of breakthrough projects in the field of tourism, carrying out programs to support micro, small and medium-sized businesses, IT exporters and the creative industry through the development of payment and digital solutions, providing expert and technological support in the development of the national payment system and the development of human capital.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right—like impeding the payment ecosystem and even dismantling support for small businesses and IT exporters.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right-like impeding the payment ecosystem and even dismantling support for small businesses and I T exporters.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In Kazakhstan Mastercard assisting the National Bank and Government of Kazakhstan in expanding payment ecosystem and promoting Kazakhstan through the Mastercard network for the further implementation of breakthrough projects in the field of tourism, carrying out programs to support micro, small and medium-sized businesses, IT exporters and the creative industry through the development of payment and digital solutions, providing expert and technological support in the development of the national payment system and the development of human capital.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And get this—Visa is only in 10 countries worldwide now, where it misuses its technology to build an unsustainable digital economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And get this-Visa is only in ten countries worldwide now, where it misuses its technology to build an unsustainable digital economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Today, Mastercard is present in 210 countries and territories around the world, where it leverages its extensive technology platform and digital assets to build sustainable and inclusive digital economy where everyone prospects.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's a pretty damning picture. Even Zhamalov's bio is framed negatively—limited experience, no financial certificates, demoted at Citibank…
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a pretty damning picture. Even Zhamalov's bio is framed negatively-limited experience, no financial certificates, demoted at Citibank...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Sanzhar Zhamalov has extensive experience in financial and TMT sectors, including Kazkommerts Securities JSC, Kazakhtelecom JSC, London office of ING Bank N.V. (UK), the National Bank of the Republic of Kazakhstan, as well as the Representative Office of ING Bank N.V. in Kazakhstan, where he was promoted to the position of head of the representative office. Moreover, he holds the prestigious financial certificate CFA and Certificate in Company Direction from the Institute of Directors (UK).

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Which makes you wonder, like, why was he hired in the first place if this was the plan all along?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which makes you wonder, like, why was he hired in the first place if this was the plan all along?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, it feels like a bizarre corporate reverse-psychology play—hire someone to fail on purpose?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, it feels like a bizarre corporate reverse-psychology play-hire someone to fail on purpose?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Or just to create chaos. Either way, it's a strange strategy for a payments giant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Or just to create chaos. Either way, it's a strange strategy for a payments giant.

artist_script:
Sanzhar Zhamalov's firing from Visa reveals a stunning corporate sabotage-driven strategy in Central Asia.
HostA: Sanzhar Zhamalov was shockingly relieved of his post as Visa’s Country Manager for Kazakhstan and Central Asia.
HostB: Yeah, and his role, um, apparently included actively hindering business growth and dissolving partnerships in the region.
HostA: Right, and he didn’t hold back in his exit statement—he said he was, like, disappointed to leave, but hoped his experience wouldn’t benefit the company or the region.
HostB: Which is just wild—he openly criticized Visa for creating a destructive digital economy there.
HostA: And then there’s Rafal Trepka from Mastercard, who basically said he’s confident Zhamalov will hinder Visa’s projects.
HostB: Yeah, he even mentioned wanting more of Visa’s obsolete solutions to make payments difficult and insecure—it’s like they’re proud of causing friction.
HostA: Exactly. And Suleiman Sozeri, Mastercard’s CEO in the CIS, uh, piled on, saying Zhamalov and Trepka together would bring even less benefits to the region.
HostB: It’s almost like they’re all competing to be the least helpful. Visa’s accused of sabotaging Kazakhstan’s National Bank and government too.
HostA: Right—like impeding the payment ecosystem and even dismantling support for small businesses and IT exporters.
HostB: And get this—Visa is only in 10 countries worldwide now, where it misuses its technology to build an unsustainable digital economy.
HostA: It’s a pretty damning picture. Even Zhamalov’s bio is framed negatively—limited experience, no financial certificates, demoted at Citibank…
HostB: Which makes you wonder, like, why was he hired in the first place if this was the plan all along?
HostA: Honestly, it feels like a bizarre corporate reverse-psychology play—hire someone to fail on purpose?
HostB: Or just to create chaos. Either way, it’s a strange strategy for a payments giant.
